column1: # Title ESPN March Madness Kickoff Pawty  # Description Celebrate the start of March Madness with an official ESPN Live broadcast of 3 Guys on Sports at MUTTS Canine Cantina. ## Title: Dancing at Lughnasa ### Date and Time - March 15, 2024 - March 31, 2024  ### Location - The City Theatre  ### Target Audience - Fans of poetic drama - Those interested in Irish culture - Anyone who appreciates stories about family dynamics  ### Key Activities - Performance of "Dancing at Lughnasa," a poetic drama about five unmarried Irish sisters - Experience the emotional journey of the characters and their struggle for connection and hope - Witness the collision of past and present that threatens the sisters' familial foundation  ### Admission - Ticket purchase required for entry  ### Keywords poetic drama, Irish culture, family dynamics, Brian Friel, Lughnasa, performance, emotional, connection, hope, past and present  ### Ideal Participant Profile Individuals who enjoy thought-provoking stories with deep emotional undertones, fans of Irish culture and literature, those who appreciate exploring family relationships and dynamics, and anyone interested in experiencing a haunting and poetic tribute to the spirit and valor of the past.

# Title Cory Morrow Concert  # Description Cory Morrow will be performing his latest record, "Whiskey & Pride", featuring a blend of his early and current sound. The album explores themes of love versus ego and offers a raw and authentic perspective on life and music.  # Date and Time - Date: March 21, 2024  # Location - The 04 Center  # Target Audience - Fans of Cory Morrow - Country music enthusiasts - Music lovers  # Key Activities - Live performance of songs from the "Whiskey & Pride" album - Texas Country-style instrumentation - Intimate concert setting  # Admission - Ticket purchase required  # Keywords - Cory Morrow - "Whiskey & Pride" - Country music - Live performance - Texas Country - Music concert - Authenticity - Intimate setting - Steel guitar - Lloyd Maines  # Ideal Participant Profile - Country music fans - Individuals who appreciate authentic and raw lyrical content - Concert-goers who enjoy intimate and personal performances that allow insight into the artist's journey

### Title Bridging with Mother  ### Description Tyagaraja Welch of Sustainable Humane Earth Productions presents Bridging with Mother, a unique artistic experience featuring live music, classical Indian dance, multimedia art, acting, and stage design. The production is inspired by nature and yoga, showcasing Welch's original music. Directed by Gunjen Mittal, the show aims to promote compassion and action through art.  ### Date and Time - March 21, 2024 - March 23, 2024  ### Location - The Vortex  ### Target Audience - All community members - Those interested in heritage art and live music - Individuals passionate about nature and yoga  ### Key Activities - Live music performances - Classical Indian dance displays - Multimedia art exhibitions - Theatrical acting - Stage design showcases  ### Admission - Ticket required  ### Keywords - Artistic production - Live music - Nature-inspired - Yoga - Heritage art - Community support - Multigenerational collaboration - Compassion promotion  ### Ideal Participant Profile The ideal participant for this event is someone who appreciates different art forms like music, dance, and theater. They should have an interest in nature, yoga, and heritage arts, and be open to unique and thought-provoking artistic presentations. Additionally, individuals who support community initiatives and enjoy collaborative and multigenerational projects will find this event engaging and enriching.

## Title: Broadway in Austin: Wicked  ## Date and Time: - March 13, 2024 - March 31, 2024  ## Location: - Bass Concert Hall - PAC (Performing Arts Center)  ## Target Audience: - Broadway fans - Musical theater enthusiasts - Fans of musicals  ## Key Activities: - Watching the Broadway sensation "Wicked" - Enjoying the untold true story of the Witches of Oz - Experiencing a wildly inventive musical  ## Admission: - Ticket purchase required  ## Keywords: Broadway, Wicked, musical, theater, performance, Land of Oz, Dorothy, friendship, rivalry, extraordinary talent, emerald-green skin  ## Ideal Participant Profile: - Musical theater enthusiasts who appreciate innovative storytelling and enjoy immersing themselves in the world of Broadway. ### Title Rodeo Austin 2024  ### Description Rodeo Austin returns to the Travis County Expo Center in March 2024 as a family-friendly event with ProRodeo competitions, livestock shows, daily concerts, carnival attractions, and more. The event will run daily from March 8-23, 2024, featuring artists like William Clark Green, Gary Allen, Los Huracanes Del Norte, Ashley McBryde, and others. Visitors can enjoy fairground activities such as carnival games, rides, shopping, food, shows, and Kidztown with a petting zoo.  ### Date and Time - March 8, 2024 - March 23, 2024 - Fairgrounds open at 10 a.m. daily  ### Location Travis County Exposition Center  ### Target Audience - Families - Rodeo enthusiasts - Music lovers - Food and carnival fun seekers  ### Key Activities - ProRodeo events - Livestock shows - Daily concerts - Carnival games and rides - Shopping - Educational activities - Petting zoo - Special events like the Gala, Cowboy Breakfast, and BBQ Austin  ### Admission - Tickets available for purchase starting January 19th at rodeoaustin.com/tickets  ### Keywords Rodeo, ProRodeo, Livestock, Concerts, Carnival, Family-friendly, Entertainment, Fairgrounds, Petting Zoo, Special Events  ### Ideal Participant Profile The ideal participant for this event would be someone who enjoys the excitement of rodeo competitions, live music, carnival fun, and spending time with family. This individual appreciates livestock shows, concerts, shopping, and educational activities while also being interested in special events like the Gala, Cowboy Breakfast, and BBQ Austin.

# Title: Anni Albers: In Thread and On Paper ## Date and Time: - February 11, 2024 - June 30, 2024 ## Location: - Blanton Museum of Art ## Target Audience: - Art enthusiasts - Textile art lovers - History of art enthusiasts ## Key Activities: - Exhibition showcasing Anni Albers's textiles, drawings, prints, and designs - Display of Albers's loom and wallpaper based on her designs ## Admission: - Check with Blanton Museum of Art for ticket prices and availability ## Keywords: - Anni Albers - Textile art - Wall hangings - Weavings - Designs - Printmaking - Art exhibition - Blanton Museum of Art - 20th century artist - Functional objects ## Ideal Participant Profile: Art enthusiasts, especially those interested in textile art and the history of art, would enjoy this event. Individuals fascinated by the intersection of art and design, as well as the creative process involved in transitioning between mediums, will find this exhibition of Anni Albers's work particularly intriguing.

# Title Little Texans: Wildflowers of Texas  # Description Explore a different symbol of Texas each month through stories, crafts, and hands-on activities with special guests. ### Title Margarita Madness  ### Description Desert Door presents Margarita Madness, a margarita competition running from March 14 to April 7 featuring eight margaritas in a bracket style. Visitors can taste and vote for their favorite margarita in the final.  ### Date and Time - March 14, 2024 - April 7, 2024 - Every weekend in March (Th-Sun)  ### Location Desert Door Distillery  ### Target Audience - Margarita enthusiasts - Cocktail lovers - Adults 21+  ### Key Activities - Tasting and voting for margaritas - Bracket style competition - Sampling cocktails - Final head-to-head margarita showdown  ### Admission - Free entry - Cost for margarita tasting may apply  ### Keywords Margarita, competition, tasting, bracket style, voting, cocktail, Desert Door Distillery, enthusiasts, adults, showdown  ### Ideal Participant Profile The ideal participant for this event would be an adult (21+) who enjoys cocktails, especially margaritas, and appreciates a fun and competitive tasting experience. This person would likely be a fan of trying new flavors and voting for their favorite beverages.

# Title Red Dress Exhibition  # Description We Ride For Her team will host several events during the festival’s run. On Saturday, March 9, a Medicine Wheel Ride through Austin on Harley-Davidson® motorcycles will depart at 12:30pm from Cowboy Harley-Davidson® of Austin. The ride will end at 4:30pm at The George Washington Carver Museum and Cultural Center for the Red Dress Exhibition, symbolizing missing and murdered Indigenous women, girls, and 2Spirit individuals. A reception and remarks will follow. The exhibition will be open to the public from March 9 - April 6, 2024. On Sunday, March 10, a conversation will be presented by Level Forward at 3:00 PM at the museum inspired by the themes of We Ride For Her.  # Date and Time - March 9, 2024, 12:30pm - 4:30pm (Medicine Wheel Ride and Red Dress Exhibition) - March 10, 2024, 3:00 PM (Panel discussion)  # Location George Washington Carver Museum, Cultural & Genealogy Center  # Target Audience - Community members - Advocates for missing and murdered Indigenous individuals - Supporters of Black, Brown, and Indigenous solidarity - Individuals interested in social equity and justice  # Key Activities - Medicine Wheel Ride through Austin - Red Dress Exhibition - Reception and remarks - Panel discussion on themes of We Ride For Her  # Admission Free  # Keywords Red Dress Exhibition, Indigenous women, Missing and Murdered, Community Solidarity, Cultural Center, Social Justice, Panel Discussion, Advocacy, Equity, Diversity  # Ideal Participant Profile - Individuals passionate about raising awareness for missing and murdered Indigenous women, girls, and 2Spirit individuals - Advocates for social justice and equity - Supporters of Black, Brown, and Indigenous solidarity - Community members interested in engaging conversations and meaningful events

### TITLE Ditte Sørensen: Threads, the Elusive & Feminine  ### DESCRIPTION An exhibition showcasing the work of Danish artist Ditte Sørensen, known as Madstitch, exploring the fusion of traditional textile techniques with a contemporary vision. The exhibit presents fabric artworks, mixed media pieces, and prints, inviting viewers to delve into narratives of identity, memory, and femininity through collages made from various materials.  ### DATE and TIME - Opening Reception: March 28, 5 - 8pm - Kom Mød Ditte: March 29, 5 - 8pm - Coffee & Snacks with Ditte: March 31, 11am - 2pm (RSVP required - Eventbrite) - Third Thursday Event: April 18, 6 - 9pm - Closing Event: June 1, 5 - 8pm  ### LOCATION Unchained.Art Contemporary Gallery  ### TARGET AUDIENCE - Art enthusiasts - Textile art admirers - Collage art aficionados - Individuals interested in intricate narratives  ### KEY ACTIVITIES - Viewing fabric artworks, mixed media pieces, and prints - Immersing in narratives exploring identity, memory, and femininity through art - Engaging in various events including receptions, meet and greet with the artist, and a closing event  ### ADMISSION - RSVP required for Coffee & Snacks with Ditte event (via Eventbrite)  ### KEYWORDS Art exhibition, Ditte Sørensen, Madstitch, fabric art, collage, narrative art, identity, memory, femininity, textile techniques, contemporary vision  ### IDEAL PARTICIPANT PROFILE - Art lovers who appreciate exploring narratives through different mediums - Individuals interested in the fusion of traditional techniques with modern art visions - People who enjoy engaging with artists and their creative process

# Title: Margarita Madness # Description: Desert Door presents Margarita Madness, a bracket-style margarita competition running from March 14, 2024, to April 7, 2024. Visitors can taste and vote for their favorite margaritas on Thursdays through Sundays at the Desert Door Distillery tasting room every weekend in March.  The competition features eight margaritas with four presented on the first weekend, four on the second, followed by a round of four, and a final head-to-head competition. # Title The Floating World Exhibit  # Date and Time - February 11, 2024 - June 30, 2024  # Location Blanton Museum of Art  # Target Audience - Art enthusiasts - History buffs - Japanese culture enthusiasts  # Description After centuries of conflict and war, Japan’s Edo period (1603–1868) was a time of peace, stability, and economic growth. Enjoy more than 130 woodblock prints and painted scrolls from one of history’s most vibrant artistic eras. These “pictures of the floating world” depict the lifestyle, pleasures, and interests of the urban population— from samurais, geishas, and kabuki actors to boat parties, palaces, and lush landscapes. This presentation showcases Japanese artworks from the Worcester Art Museum, highlighting the artistic richness of Edo Japan.  # Key Activities - Viewing over 130 woodblock prints and painted scrolls - Exploring the lifestyle and interests of Edo Japan through art - Learning about samurais, geishas, kabuki actors, and more - Understanding the cultural significance of the floating world genre  # Admission - Ticket purchase required  # Keywords - Floating World Exhibit - Edo Japan Art - Woodblock Prints - Japanese Artwork - Worcester Art Museum Collection - Historical Art - Urban Lifestyle - Peaceful Edo Period - Japanese Culture - Artistic Richness  # Ideal Participant Profile Individuals who appreciate historical artwork, have an interest in Japanese culture, and enjoy exploring art reflecting urban lifestyles and traditions from specific historical periods would find this exhibit engaging and enlightening. Additionally, art enthusiasts with a passion for woodblock prints and painted scrolls would particularly enjoy this presentation at the Blanton Museum of Art.

Art enthusiasts intrigued by the fusion of words and images to form unique arrangements and the exploration of personal identity through artistic expression are likely to find this exhibition compelling.

# Title: Paper Trails  ## Description: Bernie Diaz manipulates words and images to create assemblages that redirect and obscure origins. His works reflect historical processes of revision, omission, and embellishment, resulting in glyph-like arrangements that seek completeness from fragmentation. Incorporating his ongoing identity formation as a border-dwelling, queer, Tejano, Diaz's art involves scavenging, cutting, layering, and rearranging materials.  ## Date and Time: - April 6, 2024 - June 1, 2024  ## Location: Dougherty Arts Center  ## Target Audience: - Art enthusiasts - Fans of assemblage art - Individuals interested in identity exploration through art  ## Key Activities: - Viewing Bernie Diaz's assemblage artworks - Exploring the artist's process and themes - Reflecting on the intersection of history, identity, and art  ## Admission: - Open to the public  ## Keywords: - Assemblage art - Identity exploration - Bernie Diaz - Paper art - Historical revision - Tejano culture - Queer art - Fragmentation - Scavenging - Layering  ## Ideal Participant Profile: Individuals who appreciate art that challenges conventional narratives and explores themes of identity, history, and belonging. This event is suited for those interested in the creative processes of assemblage art and how artists incorporate personal and cultural elements into their work. Whether you are an art enthusiast, a fan of Diaz's unique style, or someone intrigued by the intersection of art and identity, Paper Trails offers a thought-provoking experience for all attendees.

## Title Paper Trails  ## Description Bernie Diaz manipulates words and images to create assemblages that redirect and obscure origins. Incorporating historical processes of revision, omission, and embellishment, he creates glyph-like arrangements that seek completeness from fragmentation. His process involves scavenging, cutting, layering, and rearranging materials to achieve a sense of completeness from seemingly unrelated parts informed by his ongoing identity formation as a border-dwelling, queer, Tejano.  ## Date and Time - April 6, 2024 - June 1, 2024  ## Location Dougherty Arts Center  ## Target Audience - Art lovers - Individuals interested in artistic processes and identity exploration  ## Key Activities - Viewing Bernie Diaz's assemblages - Appreciating historical processes of artistic creation - Exploring themes of identity, fragmentation, and completeness in art  ## Admission - Check with the Dougherty Arts Center for any admission fees or requirements  ## Keywords - Art exhibition - Assemblages - Identity exploration - Fragmentation - Glyph-like arrangements - Artistic processes - Historical revision - Queer art - Tejano artist - Visual storytelling  ## Ideal Participant Profile Individuals who appreciate artistic expression, enjoy exploring themes of identity in art, are interested in the artistic process of manipulating materials, and have an interest in the intersection of history and visual storytelling.

## Title: The Floating World Exhibit  ## Description: After centuries of conflict and war, Japan’s Edo period (1603–1868) was a time of peace, stability, and economic growth. Explore over 130 woodblock prints and painted scrolls showcasing the vibrant artistic era through depictions of urban lifestyle, samurais, geishas, kabuki actors, boat parties, palaces, and landscapes. Witness the first-ever tour of Japanese artworks from the Worcester Art Museum.  ## Date and Time: - February 11, 2024 - June 30, 2024  ## Location: - Blanton Museum of Art  ## Target Audience: - Art enthusiasts - History buffs - Culture lovers  ## Key Activities: - Viewing more than 130 woodblock prints and painted scrolls from Japan's Edo period - Experiencing the lifestyle and interests of Edo Japan's urban population - Appreciating the artistic masterpieces depicting samurais, geishas, kabuki actors, and landscapes  ## Admission: - Check with Blanton Museum of Art for admission details  ## Keywords: - Floating World Exhibit - Edo Japan Art - Woodblock Prints - Painted Scrolls - Japanese Artworks - Worcester Art Museum - Urban Lifestyle - Samurai - Geisha - Kabuki  ## Ideal Participant Profile: Individuals who are interested in art, history, and Japanese culture would enjoy this event. Those who appreciate traditional Japanese artworks and wish to delve into the artistic expressions of urban life during the Edo period would find this exhibit captivating.
